alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 19 at 2:48PM MDT until April 19 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ..RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 10 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR MUCH OF CENTRAL, EAST CENTRAL AND NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN AND NORTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... .Windy conditions will persist through early evening, keeping the threat of critical fire weather conditions going. Temperatures will drop and cool overnight, but humidity will be unable to recover very efficiently with many zones struggling to reach 25 to 35 percent by Thursday morning. Going into the afternoon Thursday, windy conditions will redevelop with very dry air invading the area. This along with another round of unstable conditions will lead to more critical conditions Thursday afternoon, namely across central, east central and northeastern areas of New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Red Flag Warning Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), Upper Rio Grande and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121) North Central Mountains (Zone 120) below significant snowpack, Sangre de Cristo Mountains below significant snowpack (Zone 122) until 10 PM MDT today. Fire Weather Watch for same areas noon to 8 pm MDT Thursday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph today. Northwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph Thursday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Around 6 to 12 percent at the lower elevations today and Thursday. Around 15 to 22 percent above 8500 feet in the North Central and Sangre de Cristo Mountains today and Thursday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
